Column Comment.0: LEASE OR UNIT IDENTIFIER: Number or code assigned as an alias that uniquelyidentifies a lease or unit for production monitoring and reporting purposes.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.3: AREA TYPE ID: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.8: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.9: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.10: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.11: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.12: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.13: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.14: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.15: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
